theresa.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting for all participants on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00

alexander.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting for all participants on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00

virginia.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting for all participants on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00

lisa.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting for all participants on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00

natalie.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting for all participants on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00

victoria.goal: Schedule a 30 minute meeting for all participants on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants' schedules and produce a joint 30 minute meeting time on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that works for all participants

public_information: Work hours on Monday are 09:00 to 17:00
All participants must attend the same meeting on Monday
Time slots are considered in 30 minute granularity

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language). You produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward PDDL solver. Always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: Your name is theresa. You are in an environment with the following public information: {environment->public_information} You have the following knowledge: {agents->theresa->private_information} This is the global goal to solve: {agents->theresa->goal} Think step by step and provide a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file that represents your availability and suggests valid 30 minute meeting slots. If you miss some information do not make assumptions, just give a plan that concerns the information you have. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert with multi-agent PDDL problems (Planning Domain Definition Language). You produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file compatible with the FastDownward PDDL solver. You always enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags. If there are multiple agents, keep their actions distinct.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. There are six agents planning to schedule a meeting. You will receive their PDDL domains and problems. You have to integrate them to schedule a single 30 minute meeting for Monday that satisfies every participant's constraints. Keep in mind that the PDDL responses you receive may be partial or contain ambiguities. A partial PDDL may require integrating additional information. Ambiguities may involve naming differences or slot representations. Here is the PDDL from each agent: {pddl_theresa} {pddl_alexander} {pddl_virginia} {pddl_lisa} {pddl_natalie} {pddl_victoria} Integrate the agents' PDDL information, keep actions of agents distinct, and produce a combined PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file targeting the FastDownward solver that yields a valid meeting time for all participants. Enclose the pddl domain between <domain></domain> tags and the pddl problem between <problem></problem> tags.
